intro: Castilleja chromosa, commonly known as the chromosa milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It forms a symbiotic relationship with the roots of other plants, drawing nutrients from them. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
